meanings.definition: Scutches (verb): to remove or scrape off the surface of something
meanings.sent1: She scutches the old paint off the wall before repainting it.
meanings.sent2: The gardener scutches the weeds from the flower bed to keep it tidy.
meanings.sent3: Tom scutches the mud off his shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor scutches away the excess clay to reveal the hidden figure within.
meanings.sent5: The chef scutches the burnt parts off the toast to salvage it for breakfast.

meanings.definition: Scutches (noun): a tool used for scraping or shaping wood or stone
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a scutches to smooth the rough edges of the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the right scutches for carving intricate designs on the marble.
meanings.sent3: The scutches in the workshop clanked together as the workers prepared for the day.
meanings.sent4: His creativity soared as he wielded the scutches, transforming the block of wood into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scutches displayed in the museum showcased the craftsmanship of bygone eras.
